isis.stitle: Recall 98508 - Vehicle Recall for 9100, 9200, 9300, and 9400 Models with Spicer SPL170 Driveline

recall.subject: Vehicle Recall for 9100, 9200, 9300, and 9400 Models with Spicer SPL170 Driveline

defect.para: This Recall applies to 9100, 9200, 9300, and 9400 models built from 10/7/96 through 9/16/98 with a Spicer SPL170 driveline with a 55 mm diameter stub end and a center bearing.

Certain 9000 Model Trucks equipped with an SPL170 driveline with 55 mm center bearing packages have experienced loosening of the end yoke retaining nut. If this condition occurs, the driveline may vibrate and could lead to a separation from the vehicle causing vehicle damage or personal injury or both.

Owners will be notified of this campaign on their vehicles by Navistar. An owner will call prior to bringing their vehicle in so that parts can be ordered and available when the appointment is scheduled. If a part is not readily available within 48 hours, then inform the customer that there is an interim action that should be implemented until the part is available. Please explain to the customer the interim action if parts are not readily available. (See SERVICE PROCEDURE below.) A listing of owner names and addresses has been furnished to the involved dealers for follow up with owners to have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE (Instructions for the Interim Procedure for Spicer SPL170 Driveline with 55 mm Center Bearing Package

note.para: This procedure should only be completed as an interim action until parts for the customer are readily available.

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Disconnect the positive battery cables at the batteries.

On the threads of the driveline center bearing stub end and the rear side of the yoke retaining nut, place one spot weld to eliminate the nut from backing off. Make sure you get good weld penetration into the threaded stub end.
Reconnect the positive battery cables.
Reschedule another appointment with the customer when the part is available.

note.para: The 55 mm stub end, yoke and center bearing are no longer available in service parts or from Spicer.

svcproc.title: Spicer SPL170 55 mm to 60 mm Driveline, Center Bearing and Center Bearing Bracket Upgrade Instructions

step1.para: Duplicate the Parts Order form. Complete all requested information and fax to Dana at the fax number listed. Dana will ship a kit specifically for the vehicle listed on the order form. Delivery should be within 24 hours.

The repair kit will be identified with the VIN and customer name. Compare the VIN # to the kit received. The kit will contain the coupling shaft with assembled center bearing and center bearing bracket needed for the VIN being serviced. The kit part number should match the last 8 characters of the VIN to be serviced.
Perform a routine inspection of all drive shafts.
Avoiding contact with the driveshaft slip boot; support the drive shaft connected to the coupling shaft yoke in the chassis so it does not fall out when disconnected.

Referring to the Navistar service procedures for the chassis you are updating, remove the U-joint attaching bolts and U-joint retainers from the center bearing yoke. Discard the U-joint retainer bolts.
Separate the drive shaft U-joint from the coupling shaft yoke and support the drive shaft in a position that allows replacement of the coupling shaft assembly.
Support the coupling shaft in the chassis so it does not fall out when disconnected.

Remove the U-joint attaching bolts and U-joint retainers from the transmission output yoke and bolts holding the center bearing to the center bearing bracket on the crossmember. The center bearing bracket bolts will be re-used.
Remove the coupling shaft and center bearing assembly from the vehicle. Discard the coupling shaft assembly.
Remove the center bearing bracket from the vehicle crossmember. Discard the bracket. The bolts for the bracket will be re-used.
Re-install the NEW center bearing bracket from the kit using the bolts removed earlier (P/N 414052C1 1/2 inch bolt Grade 8). Torque the bolts to 100 - 120 ft-lbs.
Install the NEW coupling shaft from the kit into the chassis and support it.
Install the center bearing to the new bracket using the bolts previously removed (P/N 414052C1 1/2 inch bolt Grade 8). Torque the bolts to 100 - 120 ft-lbs.
Install the U-joint bearing retainers at the transmission end yoke and install the NEW bearing retainer bolts from the kit. Torque the bolts to 100 - 120 ft-lbs.

Re-install the drive shaft to the coupling shaft by placing the drive shaft U-joint into the coupling shaft end yoke at the center bearing. Be sure to properly seat the U-joint bearing caps. Install the NEW bearing retainer bolts from the kit. Torque the bolts to 100 - 120 ft-lbs.

Thoroughly lubricate ALL U-joints in the vehicle. Following the Navistar Service Manual CTS-5000 recommendations, fully purge all U-joints until CLEAN grease appears at ALL FOUR BEARING CAPS of each U-joint. Refer to the Figure.

partsinfo.para: Use a copy of the provided fax sheet to order correct coupling shaft kit for each VIN. Part numbers are set up according to VIN numbers. Reproduce fax sheet locally. Use 1 fax sheet for each vehicle. Part Kits will be supplied at no cost.

Since parts for this campaign are being supplied on a "no charge" basis, a $30 dealer handling charge will be allowed. This charge should be submitted as an outside charge on the Warranty Claim as "Handling Allowance."

entry.para: Perform spot weld on stub end threads and retaining nut
Replace coupling shaft yoke and center bearing bracket

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location. Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his vehicle as soon as possible.
